mdRecord.dcterms:title: Group of visitors at Home of Washington, Mount Vernon, Va, September 14, 1887
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dillon, Luke C., 1836-1904
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white mounted photographic print of a group of visitors with their horse and carriage near the central passage entrance along the west front of the Mansion. The members of the group include - in carriage: Mrs. Eliza [Elizabeth] Timberlake (of Brucetown, VA); Miss Meta Jackson (standing); Miss Florence Hewitt or Huyett (seated); Miss Lida Timberlake (standing on stoop); and Miss Mattie [Martha Elizabeth] Hannon (married name Best) seated near driver whose name is "George." With the exception of "George" all names appear in the Mount Vernon guest register. A notation on the photograph as well as a typescript caption (in file) identifies the woman on the far left as Hannah Jones Lunt. Text printed on cardboard mount: Luke C. Dillon, Photographer, Washington D. C. Office, 935 Penn. Avenue, Pullman's Gallery.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
